text:
(1)
410, 412, 414, 416-18 Pleasant Avenue at S.E. corner of 122nd Street. 416-18, the plant of the Pleasant Paper Company, was built shortly prior to 1930, replacing two three-story frame houses which occupied the site since the 1860's. The remaining frame house is shown at 414. "The Pleasant" is a five-story apartment house erected around 1890; and 410, the brownstone house with the stoop, is older than that.
September 19, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
A closer view, two years earlier, of the corner building and the surviving frame house, 414, 416-418 Pleasant Avenue.
1932.

J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.

414 Pleasant Ave., south of the S.E. corner of East 122nd Street. Building concerned is a 2-story frame house.

September 12, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.
